document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision and revalidation of Nycterilampus Montrouzier (Coleoptera: Elateridae, Agrypninae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Redescription. Male. Length 25.0–32.0 mm. Integument black, except for: red-brown sublateral stripes on the pronotum; hypomera red-brown with lateral margin darker; legs and antennae brown. Head length 2.1 mm , prothorax length: 6.0 mm, prothorax width: 6.5 mm , elytral length: 16.5 mm , humeral width: 6.0 mm.

Elytra 2.8 times longer than pronotal length. Elytral striae weakly impressed; interestriae with punctation very fine, dense and rasp-like; apices acuminate and divergent with a small sutural spine. Epipleura tapering to metacoxal plate.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 2–9.
Nycterilampus velutinus Fleutiaux, 1891
. 2, 3, antennae (male, female); 7, head and pronotum (female).
N . lifuanus Montrouzier, 1860
. 4, 5, antennae (male, female); 6, head; 8, head and pronotum (dorsal); 9 prothorax (ventral).

FIGURES 10–18.
Nycterilampus lifuanus Montrouzier, 1860
(male). 10, 11, mesoscutum and scutellum (dorsal, lateral); 12, 13, mesoventrite (ventral, lateral); 14, 15, pterothorax (ventral, ventro–lateral); 16, tarsal claw; 17, hind wing; 18, metanotum.

FIGURES 19–26.
Nycterilampus lifuanus Montrouzier, 1860
(male). 19, sternite IX; 20, tergites IX – X; 21, sternite VIII; 22, tergite VIII; 23, abdomen (ventral); 24, 25, aedeagus (dorsal, ventral).
N . velutinus Fleutiaux, 1891
(male). 26, aedeagus (ventral).

FIGURES 27–30.
Nycterilampus lifuanus
Montrouzier, 1860
(female). 27, tergite VIII; 28, sternite VIII; 29, ovipositor (ventral); 30, ovipositor and reproductive organs (dorsal).

and

( IRSNB ). VANUATU (“ New Hebrides ”). Fry Coll. 1905 – 100 , Brazier,

( BMNH ).
Discussion . Successive attempts to locate the Montrouzier type-material had been unfruitful. For this reason we work with specimens from New Caledonia of sufficient trustworthy identification.
